etymology.description: 氵(水) (shuǐ, "water") + phonetic 京(京) (jīng) = coolness related to water -> 涼
etymology.interpretation: The character 涼(涼) (liáng, "cool") combines the water radical 氵(水) (shuǐ, "water") with the phonetic 京(京) (jīng) to convey the idea of coolness or freshness typically associated with water.
etymology.simplification: 涼(涼) was simplified to 凉(涼) by removing the water radical 氵(水) (shuǐ, "water") and retaining the phonetic 京(京), thus reducing strokes while maintaining phonetic sound.

examples.chinese: 夏日午后很凉(夏日午後很涼)。
微风吹过(微風吹過)，带来丝丝凉意(帶來絲絲涼意)。
examples.pinyin: Wēifēng chuīguò, dài lái sī sī liáng yì.
examples.english: The breeze blows by, bringing a hint of coolness.

examples.chinese: 夏夜乘凉(夏夜乘涼)，享受微风(享受微風)。
examples.pinyin: Xià yè chéng liáng, xiǎngshòu wēifēng.
examples.english: Taking in the coolness of a summer night while enjoying the gentle breeze.
